title: Why does listening to certain songs make me angry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, my best guess is that: The song could have stated something that you disagree with triggering anger.It could be about a rich person complaining that they didn’t get what they want when they have much to be grateful for.It could be about a poor person getting something they very well deserved and earned taken away from them.Could’ve triggered some flashback to something traumatic that may have occurred in the past.Might've of reminded you of worldwide issues.Could’ve reminded you of something that happened to a friend that is unfair.These are my best guesses…

I can so relate to this question, I don't have any scientific answers, but what I do know is alot of the anger is misdirected at something other than the song itself, with a few exceptions. Some types of music plays and Bam! My stomach starts wrenching, I feel like walls are closing in on me, indoors or outdoors, and I just want it to go away, the song, the music the memory all of it. Of course the feeling stays for awhile, that's when I make the decision if I'm going to run with the anger, or not. I have done both, q
